titleStmt.title: An Encoded Transcription of a Borrower's Card: Fernand Colens

msIdentifier.repository: Princeton University. Library. Dept. of Rare Books and Special Collections

change.ab: Encoded cards. s1: = "Colhoise"? = "D Samie"? ==> "Drama" = no idea ==> "Light" = no idea, note next to Swinburne s2: = "Santinis"? ==> Scrutiny s3: = no idea, not a date? ==> "Post" = no idea, note next to "Dekker"? (not sure about that either) ==> Mermaid Series = "Wegnell"? ==> Meynell = "Goruiau"? ==> Gorman s4: lots of difficult to read notation at top of card = no idea = "Renenits"? == = "Column's"? ==> Colvin's s6: = "heresy"? ==> Pleasures = no idea ==> Saul = no idea, note on T.S. Eliot = "Shande"? ==> Strange s7: = "Ferris"? = "Tobin"? s8: = "Loreggo"? ==> Lorenzo s9: = "Hesperis"? = "Cuopen"? s10: = "Saves"? = "gurson"? s11: "ACCOUNT SUMMER" pasted on to card s12: = date illegible s15: = "choir"? = "Shening 'rue"? = "Panaden'? = "kitting"? note written over dates, "call" someone s16: = "scrunting"? = "resoins"? s17: = "Ziberahse"? s18: = "Bundet"? s19: = "Col Wal"? s20: = "Sodex"? = "Fuheu"? s21: = "Palins"? = "Lineole"? s22: = "Saunking"?

Transcribed cards. s1: = "Colhoise"? = "D Samie"? = no idea = no idea, note next to Swinburne s2: = "Santinis"? s3: = no idea, not a date? = no idea, note next to "Dekker"? (not sure about that either) = "Wegnell"? = "Goruiau"? s4: lots of difficult to read notation at top of card = no idea = "Renenits"? = "Column's"? s6: = "heresy"? = no idea = no idea, note on T.S. Eliot = "Shande"? s7: = "Ferris"? = "Tobin"? s8: = "Loreggo"? s9: = "Hesperis"? = "Cuopen"? s10: = "Saves"? = "gurson"? s11: "ACCOUNT SUMMER" pasted on to card s12: = date illegible s15: = "choir"? = "Shening 'rue"? = "Panaden'? = "kitting"? note written over dates, "call" someone s16: = "scrunting"? = "resoins"? s17: = "Ziberahse"? s18: = "Bundet"? s19: = "Col Wal"? s20: = "Sodex"? = "Fuheu"? s21: = "Palins"? = "Lineole"? s22: = "Saunking"?

ab.bibl: Ben Jonson vol I (Man & His Work)

div.note: the following were returned by c/ M. Colens the 12th of Sept: Poems of Meredith 2 vols Poems Robert Browning (Everyman) (not on his card) see other page
Aug 20 received ordered & list of Books

ab.bibl: Herbert Read Phases of Eng Poetry

bibl.title: Lyrical Poetry fr. Blake to Hardy
Letter of George Gissing to his Family
Cross Currents in English Lit of the 17th C

div.note: no more books to be sent

div.head: 1930 COLENS JR 1 year, 2 vol to Nov 1st 1931 120fr
div.ab: " 23 Phases of Engl. Poetry (to buy it) " 14
July 4 Life as we have Known it }
div.note: (M. Colens can have 20% 1 year 2 vols 300 frs, 20% 240v)

bibl.title: History of romanticism in the XIX Cent

div.head: to 1 March 1933 COLENS
div.ab: Aug 25 Poems, Gerald Manly Hopkins bought
Nov 5 Necessity of Communism renewed (19 Nov)

div.head: 1933 COLENS to 1 March 1934
div.note: 3.05 New Statesman credit 8.65 paid 18.40 for reviews etc

SB wrote Sept 5 to ask if boks to be sent new address -
Hotel d'Ailefroide Pelvoux Hautes-Alpes
div.ab: Oct 7 Juan in America ren Oct 14 Oct 21

div.head: 1934 COLENS ACCOUNT SUMMER 1934 35 Mar March 7 1934 July 18 deposit for N.Star. 100v

div.ab: 10 Aug 2f As I Lay dying } 23 Aug.

div.head: COLENS subsc to March 1 1934 240
div.ab: Oct 28 New Eng Wonder Hero Nov 4

bibl.title: Use of Poetry & the use of criticism

ab.bibl: Study of the Modern Novel, Marble

div.ab: June 2 Plays Somerset Maugham v 1 never took
div.note:
left 100 frs in deposit 1 New Statesman to be sent every week
Monsieur F. Colens
Hotel Gassette PORTE (Pyréneés Orientales)
will write what books to send

div.head:
1935 COLENS
21 rue de Bagneux Sceaux Seine
Renewed 1 March 1934- 1 March 1935 --------180f
div.ab: Shelley, Peck vol II Patey Benson 13

div.note: subsc to New Statesman expires July 20
renewed for one year from July 20 1935 to July 20' 1936 paid July 2 Frs 114
div.ab: Nov 25 Powys Brothers-for Mme La Halle 11

div.head: -March 15th 1937 COLENS
div.note: owes 3.50.0 owes 65v00 see overpays! pd. b8.50 Nov 28th
div.ab: More Poems Housman Wants to buy s/
May 5. Ralph Fox Writer in Arms. May 13

div.head:
to March 15. 1936 COLENS M. Fernand
21, rue de Bagneux Sceaux
div.ab: 25. Life and Letters of john Galsworthy. July 9
div.note: subsc to New Statesman & Nation renewed for one year from July 18 1936 - July 18 1937

address summer 1936
GABAS EAUX-CHAUDES Basses- Pyréneés
Collected Poems T.S. Eliot sent owes 30.00
div.ab: Beany Eye wrote to M.Colens Aug 24

div.note: subsc due will renew for 1 yr 270v 1y new book subsc april 1st 1938 to 1939
no extras ever as has no books in Sept & Oct
div.ab: June 3 Note - Books of Hopkins (no fine) June 10
Marianne Moore'sWILFRED OWEN'S SELECTED POEMS returned

div.head:
to March 15 1938 Fernand COLENS
21 rue de Bagneux Sceaux (Seine)

(ren. July 18.37 - July 18.38) 10 balance credit of F.C.

holiday address .

bibl.title: As I was going down Sack. Street

div.ab: Dec 16 Poetical Works (Bridges) sent back Dec 29

div.head: COLENS subsc to July 11th 1940 (Nov 7 wrote to Mr Colens subsc New Statesman expired 4th Nov 1 yr 270 frs )
div.note: Nov 10 M. Colens renewed subsc to the New Statesman from Nov 4 1939 - Nov 4 1940 paid Nov 10 270 frs

bibl.title: In good King charles golden days

div.note: wrote May 16 to say Horizon expired renewed 6 mos paid 65 frs May 29

div.head:
193 COLENS (to April 1 1939 270 1 year)
Dec 22

returned
will bring it back in 2 wks
